website_summaries.verdict: Unless you have very sensitive knees, this pad is a great choice – not only is it thick and lightweight, but built to last thanks to its quality construction.
cons: Too firm for optimal comfort for some users

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardening.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not into yoga, but instead use them out in the garden. They are much more comfortable than the kneeling pads I see at the garden center. They do get dirty and hang on to sharp bits of gravel but the rocks can be picked out and the dirt brushed or hosed off just like any other kneeling pad I've used. Well worth the premium price for use in the garden. The photos show my old garden store knee pad (green) with the XL (blue) and XXL (black) RED Home Club Thick Kneeling Pads.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Mounce

customer_reviews.title: Regret purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I purchased two of these pads. They are almost as hard as the ground. If you sit on them they hurt the backs of your legs because there is no give in them. I need a pad to clean the bathtub and since these pads are slick with no gripping surface they slide right across the ceramic tile floor as soon as I lean over the tub causing me to fall on my aging knees. They do give just a little if you have sufficient weight.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Jolly

customer_reviews.title: A nice thick pad BUT....
customer_reviews.text: A nice thick pad BUT.......be aware that it is quite stiff, like a board. It will nicely cushion your knees or butt, but it is best used on flat hard surfaces - indoor or garage, etc. I was looking for something much more flexible that would be suitable for uneven, rocky surfaces in the garden. This will be OK, but only OK.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie

customer_reviews.title: I have a super boney knee with a valley between my kneecap and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a super boney knee with a valley between my kneecap and top of the femer. A big 'burr' sticks out so when I kneel down, the act of kneeling does not hurt but my weight is concentrated on this 'hill' and causes great pain. Knee pads offer some help but are a pain. Pillows offer no help. This Thick Pad does the trick! I can fall to my knees with no pain. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. E. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: NOT COLORFAST! Bleeds color like crazy
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these with my wife - a blue one and a green one. Both were stored in similar conditions in our garden shed. After a few months, green one developed severe color bleeding. Look at the photos and see what this horrible product did to brand new pants that my wife wore when she went to use it. She thought maybe it was just dirt, because no normal product should do that, and went to clean it. Look at the second photo, showing how the wet wipes looked like after cleaning it. Two thumbs down. Horrible product. Do not recommend. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: K. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Much better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Much better than anticipated! It's thick, it's strong, I used it to kneel down on the pool kooldeck and clean the skimmer.I was a UPS driver for over 30yrs so the knees are history but this was great! Absolutely no pain or pressure on either knee.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzanator

customer_reviews.title: Way too hard.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this pad was way too hard! Couldn't even put a dent in it when kneeling on it. Had to return it and bought the Cushy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Filice

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am an equipment repair technician and constantly down on one, or both knee's turning wrenches and working on machines. This pad is saving my knee's and keeping me comfortable on the job all day. Durable construction and comfortable product. People ask me about the pad also. It draws quite an interest.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well made, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product, good quality. It is strong and thick. In trying it out inside it is more firm than I thought it would be, even after reading the reviews. However, using it outside will definitely save my knees from the damp/hard ground. It is pretty nice that you can leave the cutout for the hand hole in the pad if you want or pull it out to use the handle. Again, solid, well made, good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: D. Murrells

customer_reviews.title: Not at all soft.
customer_reviews.text: For me, the pad is not a lot softer than my tile floors. I do better with a folded up bath towel. I was very disappointed when it arrived, and I will,not be using it. I have osteoarthritis in my knees, and people without knee problems may not,feel,the same way I do. I do not consider the product defective; just does not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend buying this for the money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is as hard as most of the ground I was trying to use it on. The whole purpose for paying 18 dollars for something is that it cushions your knees from injury. This definitely does not do that. Way too firm! I would not recommend buying this for the money. Find something else that is more cushioning than this. It doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, nice thickness
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, nice thickness, BUT very hard -- NO CUSHION. Does not give at all!!! I tried standing on it to see if it would give any, and I am 200 lbs,, and it did not give at all. When I got on my knees, it was like kneeling on a piece of board. I have a couple of cushions for my bad knees and they are fine but I got this one for the larger size when I clean out the bath tub. I am VERY DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a knee pad that was wider and longer and this on is perfect. My husband is a tall guy and the knee pads we have used in the past just didn't work. This one being wider and longer made it so he could put both knees on it and actually move around without falling off of it. Also it is super think so don't work about feeling rocks or anything like that under your knees. Great Quality!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Firm durometer. Perfect for 200 pound 6’ tall kneeling or sitting.
customer_reviews.text: Firm durometer. Perfect for 200 pound 6’ tall kneeling or sitting. Great for all sorts of uses including Automotive Detail or Mechanical work. It’s durable enough for kneeing to Bonsai or prune bushes. I also use it on top of my creeper stool. A perfect marriage. Which is immensely rare.
customer_reviews.author: ZZZ Accounting Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: What a knee saver!
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this mat for pulling weeds. I have since then found so many more uses! I even take it winter camping with me as it insulates from the cold ground just as well as it cushions! I have seen many pads that are similar to this one, but this foam density is where it is at, worth ever penny. I may even buy another one because I am afraid these will stop getting made.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lundberg

customer_reviews.title: Cat scratching pad
customer_reviews.text: So ... this is like gluing 3 pieces of foam pads together, the texture looks just like my wife's yoga pad, only thicker. It's a little stiff but better than kneeling without any padding Disappointed in this product, thought it would be more comfortable. Would return it as I just recieved it today but my cat used it as his scratching pad....oh well, at least he's happy!
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Sun

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Using this kneeling pad is about as good as using a wooden board. The only benefit is maybe keeping my knees or clothing a little cleaner. Too bad I didn't try it before it was too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: JMom

customer_reviews.title: I thought because it was thicker than most that it would be easy on my knees
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the one star, but it was just too darn hard. I thought because it was thicker than most that it would be easy on my knees, but that was a bad assumption. Other than that, it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Knee-pads for Kneeling
customer_reviews.text: Super tough. At first, you might think it feels too firm, but it's just right on your knees. I bought the extra, extra large-size version. I've used it for all low-down operations -- on the garage floor working on the car, picking weeds in the garden, repairing things in and around the house, whatever. I used to wear knee-pads for those operations but this is now the first thing I grab. Doesn't hold dirt, doesn't deform and it never seems to absorb moisture. It has a cutout for a handhold -- but the piece that comes out is perfect if you want to use it for hand strengthening squeezing. I'd certainly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spalmacin

customer_reviews.title: Great Knee pad for people with kneeling issues!
customer_reviews.text: It's getting harder and harder for me to kneel on the ground and then try to get up. This is a firm, good size pad that I thought was a bit too firm, but as I use it, it works great! My printer is on the floor under a table so I am constantly kneeling on the ground to copy things. This pad makes it a lot easier to kneel down and get up. Even comfy for sitting on! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Low

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband for Father's day to use in the garden. We both ended up using it when we pulled up the carpet and put down flooring in a bedroom this week and it made such a huge difference!! It is thick but has some give so you do not feel like you are kneeling on concrete and it is a good size so I was also able to sit on it comfortably. Would definitely recommend for yard work or any other project that requires kneeling/sitting.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY L

customer_reviews.title: A bit to hard and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I felt this mat was a bit hard so it was not necessarily gentle on my knees, especially if you use for prolonged periods. I was going to purchase the "Gorilla" brand but this one looked identical but a couple of bucks cheaper. Now I wonder if the other brand would have been softer. On the plus side, it's very light weight and it covers a good sizable are for you to knell down. You may also use it to sit on hard places (i.e., bleachers) for long events, etc. even though this product was not intended for it.
customer_reviews.author: norbac

customer_reviews.title: Really great kneeling pad
customer_reviews.text: Great kneeling pad, would definitely recommend. I'm 43 and it's hard to get down on the knees any more! Used it this past weekend while replacing the bathroom faucet, then again outside while working on the garden drip line. My teenage son used it as well, for both kneeling and placing under his hip while working under the bathroom sink.
customer_reviews.author: R. MORRIS

customer_reviews.title: Smells like urinal cake
customer_reviews.text: Yup, urinal cake. It reeks! Ordered one for my GF at the same time I ordered a smaller 'Gorilla Grip' pad for myself. The Gorilla Grip pad reeked like a urinal cake, but the 'RED Roof' pad had no odor at all. So ... I ordered the larger size RED Roof pad for myself. It does not have the RED Roof logo, came pre-stained (thanks(, and smells like a urinal cake. Guessing the two products (or the Gorilla and maybe a cheaper, equally smelly version of the RED pad) are manufactured by the same company in the same plant. $25 for a pre-stained, smelly pad without the actual company badging. Pass. Returning...
customer_reviews.author: Millibarman

customer_reviews.title: Much too hard.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just as hard as my floor. What's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Gillies

customer_reviews.title: Large and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I selected this pad primarily for the size - thicker should hold up longer as well as the width and length, it can be used to sit on. Once it arrived I really liked the surface, it is not porous so it should clean up nicely, I will use it at the animal shelter where I volunteer to be able to get down with the little dogs on their level in the grassy & sometimes muddy yard.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Kneeling Pad!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a VERY durable, VERY cushy kneeling pad. I broke my back some time ago and kneeling down, and then getting back up again, has become a real challenge. Most kneeling pads are either too hard, or too thin, or too flimsy. Not this one! This thing is very light weight, but is also very cushion-y, and pops back into shape very quickly after you get up. And because it has a certain degree of firmness it helps me get back up. I love this thing! In fact, I think I'll order another one to use for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Gal

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable on the knees
customer_reviews.text: I really like that it is quite hard and dense, yet still spongy enough for my old knees, and I can work on rocky surfaces. Living in Arizona, my yards are 3/4 inch rock instead of grass. They are a great knee protector. What I worry about is, that because they are so dense, they may end up cracking. If they do, I will then report it. They are also quite light weight and good and wide, for a wide knee-stance. They are inexpensive, so I might buy more of them to keep stashed here and there around my property, for convenience. I recommend giving them a try. You will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: SIDW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my knees and needed something soft but also thick enough that it didn't sink through and allow pressure on my knees while I garden. I'm a larger lady so I'm putting a good amount of weight on those pressure points. This pad works perfect for me and I just ordered a second one so I can move from one to the next without having to stand and move it.
customer_reviews.author: Chaps

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kneeling pad for my 67 year old father for Xmas. I would highly recommend this product! First, the pad comes with a information sheet on top of pad wrapped in plastic. The information sheet is fantastic especially with this being for someone else. The best reason to buy this product is because it's an excellent product! The pad is not to soft and provides comfort with support. I recommend this product to any one who has bad knees and needs the comfort and support when kneeling for gardening, cleaning, working, and etc. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio13

customer_reviews.title: My dad like the board better than knee pads
customer_reviews.text: My father (75) loves it! More than the new gel knee pads. He was putting in a new laminate floor in his house and was complaining about his knees while using some really old knee pads so I sent him both the best selling knee pads and this kneeling board, he chose the board. It’s thick and dense and distributes his weight to most of his knee for really good support. I asked a few days later if he finished the floor he said he had 2 days ago, not one complaint about his knees, he said the board works great, not sure if he will use his new knee pads thought.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable pad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad to replace others that have worn out. The old pads (different brand than this one) were much thinner, softer and just didn't hold up very well. I was at the point of using two of them together in order to have sufficient protection for my knees while gardening. This new pad is much thicker than the older pads and seems to be constructed of a material that's sturdier than other pads. Although it's not as soft and "squishy" as others I believe it will hold up for much longer than the other materials. So far I am very pleased with this pad.
customer_reviews.author: DavidPIndy

customer_reviews.title: Big, light weight, thick.
customer_reviews.text: After knee reconstruction, kneeling on my knee for more than a couple of minutes is uncomfortable. I use this pad for prayer time (i.e. - Indoors). This pad is about 1.5 times wider and at least twice as thick as the garden pad I was using before. It's been great for me. I can kneel on the concrete floor without being distracted by my knees. I wipe it down from time to time with a damp clothe. Textured surface mimizes slippage. There's a pop out section for a handhold, but I've left it in so far.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Use - Buy Two
customer_reviews.text: These are thickly padded; I used them for kneeling on the driveway while repairing cracks, so they should be comfortable for all hard surfaces. I bought two of them so I could easily move from pad to pad without getting up. They are nice and wide so I could easily kneel on one while shifting the other. The grip holes are nice and big so they're easy to get a hold of and move or pick up. The could be (just a touch) softer, but just a bit, they definitely sure the purpose and are much better, I think, than using kneepads; which is why I decided to try them in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Save those knees!
customer_reviews.text: For my fellow hvac tradesmen out there...SAVE YOUR KNEES. This is the best knee pad out there and I can't express how much this helped me working on condenser units surrounded by rocks or working in basements on hard concrete. Its thick, indestructible, and worth every penny. The only downside is that it came with a FUNKY smell most likely VOCs fresh from the factory. I left it out in the sun for a day to get the smell out. After that its smooth sailing on your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Mai

customer_reviews.title: Too hard of a foam pad. My knees still hurt.
customer_reviews.text: Not soft enough for my knees at all. I’m 35 and have bad knees and wanted a good pad to kneel on for work (I paint and have to kneel often) When I received this product, I was surprised how hard the foam is. I mean maybe it might work for some people, but in my opinion, it is way too hard. I tried kneeling on it and my knee still got sharp pains. So this pad did not work for me. If you need something extremely cushy and comforting for your knees, this will not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Plante

customer_reviews.title: I Have Four of These Pads.  They are a Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the pads that I ordered a couple of years ago, and recently ordered two more, so that a pad will be where I am when I need one. These are nice quality, thick, kneeling pads which work well to save aging knees. Being tall, I am always kneeling down to do something outside. I have had no problems with the pads, they seem to hold up well. The thickness is nice (2 inches?) when using on cement or gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Cute, Affordable
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time in our small garden. Wind, rain, or shine-these pads stay put through all weather and maintain their use for several years. Having a strained tendon in one knee has made weeding and caring for a garden difficult for me-until I found these pads! Excellent for comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Thick, Soft, No Sore Knees... Enough Said
customer_reviews.text: Really hard to go wrong on an item like this. It is nice and thick, great on an uneven or bumpy surface when I could feel those items through a thinner pad. No way you are going to feel anything but soft with this extra thick on. Nice side allows you to adjust knees without slipping off the pad. Simple item, does a simple job, but does it right.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Van Beek

customer_reviews.title: Rock hard and color bleeds on your clothes
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at just how bad a kneeler can be. I bought it to replace one I've had for a few years that was starting to age. Little did I know that this one would make my old one look amazing. If you have sensitive knees you will wonder why you got this. It's softer than the ground, but not much. And to add insult to injury, after a few weeks of use it bleeds color all over your knees. I have light blue patches on both knees now each time I use it. Truly a piece of junk, get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Gee

customer_reviews.title: Used for a seat pad in my Kayak.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super firm pad, and did not suit my purpose very well. It's really too stiff to save my tired behind in my kayak, which is what I bought it for. It claims to be waterproof, and did not seem to soak up much water, which was good. Not really fair to rate it since I do not kneel on it, but compared to my two dedicated and much appreciated garden pads, it still feels very firm to me.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Let me tell you this item is a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: I was in need for a kneeling pad for my garden work. This item seemed a little pricy but I thought I could return it if I was dissatisfied. Let me tell you this item is a keeper. For one thing the pads ample size (length width) is very helpful changing location without having to get up and move the entire pad. The firmness and thickness of the item provides a solid perch for those nasty weed pulling tasks. The hand grip size cutout allows ease of transportation and a nice opening for storage wall hooks. After wiping it down it's size and firmness provides me a handy work surface for my garden notes or frosty beverage(s).
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great mat for multiple purposes!
customer_reviews.text: I use a CPAP machine and when I turn towards my wife the air from the CPAP mask blows on my wife. We have a kingsize adjustable bed with separate bases, so the top mattresses are basically 2 twins. So, I bought this mat specifically to stand up long ways between the 2 mattresses at our head positions. The thickness and sturdiness of this mat works great for this, plus happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.author: R. Reaves

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable knee pad we've ever had. We have used them on rocks and don't feel them like others we've bought. Even cutting Pyracantha bushes with lot's of thorns. Just pick out the thorns. We would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Too firm for my knees
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews which said it was too hard, but I also saw so many which were positive that I thought I would try it out. However it was not just hard but WAY TOO HARD for my bony knees. Unbelievably hard. It is certainly sturdy and well made. I am 5'6" and weigh about 125 lbs, so this item might be perfect for a heavier person, especially if they don't have bony knees.
customer_reviews.author: SAF

customer_reviews.title: This is astonishly firm. Too, firm, actually.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 210 pounds and when I kneel on it, I don't think I sink in more than 1/2 inch. I have some arthritis, and do appliance repair. While this pad is a lot better than kneeling on the floor, it would be *much* better if it was a lot softer. It's a good deal financially, but I wouldn't buy it again. On the other hand, it doesn't hurt enough to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Carmen

customer_reviews.title: OK but too dense.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Arrived promptly in new condition. Nice size and fairly light. The handle hole is a nice option. Cons: The foam material itself is too dense for my liking. I have some knee and leg issues and I need something cushier. Some users may like the denseness of the foam.
customer_reviews.author: SFLGal

customer_reviews.title: A terrible odor
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect pad EXCEPT it has a terrible sickening odor ... I'm going to leave it outside to air it out for a few days and if that doesn't get rid of the odor, I'll be returning the pad ... Will update later
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Nice 'n Thick
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with extra thickness. It has been too cold to use it yet in Chicago. I would like to say to any new buyers that when you receive it the handle isn't punched out. When I opened it , I was disappointed no handle. Then I looked at in a brighter light and saw the outline of the handle and it just needs to be pushed out. Voila! My husband uses the punched out "donut hole" as a hand gripper/excerciser as it is quite dense. I like the bright blue so I can find it easy. I also like its very generous size.
customer_reviews.author: Ya Ya

customer_reviews.title: Not non-skid and not packaged well
customer_reviews.text: This came wrapped in plastic which made the pad curl. After unwrapping and using for a few weeks as a kneeling pad at the bathtub, it’s still curled. This makes the pad not lay flat against the floor and exacerbates the skidding of the pad agaothe tile floor when I kneel or step on it. Otherwise the material is thick and protects the knees. But I am disappointed with this product and I would have returned it, but the return window passed already.
customer_reviews.author: Gooeyduq

customer_reviews.title: Pretty thick
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be perfect for an additional yard knee pad. Some on the market are so thin, but this one is not. I bought the bright pick so can find it in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Botanical SA

customer_reviews.title: Knee saver
customer_reviews.text: A nice thick pad. I used it when kneeling on my concrete patio laying some stepping stones and pavers. Can’t imagine doing that work without this. I just left it wrapped in the clear plastic packaging it came in. I figured it would protect it from getting chewed up on the concrete and protect it from the elements as it will live under my potting table.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVER!
customer_reviews.text: Using this knee pad I'm able to pull weeds out of the mulched areas in my yard again. Yesterday I was able to kneel long enough to paint a 30 year old cast aluminum bench and it looks like new now. My only regret is that I didn't make this purchase sooner. It is sturdy but not hard, lightweight but not flimsy, and easy to maneuver. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dusguicheon

customer_reviews.title: NOT too firm!  Perfect for Xtra-Large people!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy - 6 feet tall and somewhere around 375 pounds. These kneeling pads are perfect for me! Kneeling without a pad or cushion is absolute agony on my kneecaps - even when kneeling on a carpet. Kneeling with this pad is heavenly. I use either the XXL 24x14 or the XL 18x11 (I bought them both). If the pad was any softer I'm afraid my knee would sink all the way through and I would feel the hard floor or concrete or ground underneath. As it is - it's perfect! My knees are perfectly cushioned! Even just using one knee is fine! Highly recommended for the Xtra Large people of the world!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old knees love this
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size and thicker than a lot of kneeling pads. I use it INSIDE the house for cleaning, painting, etc. My only complaint is that it comes in colors designed to find it when it's been left outdoors, not to blend unobtrusively with tasteful inside decor...but that's not its fault, I AM using it for a different purpose than it was made for.
customer_reviews.author: BWM

customer_reviews.title: Knee saver
customer_reviews.text: I have bad knees and these came to the rescue while doing a brake job. Great thickness, sturdy and has a handle for easy transport. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Had a knee replaced, I can work on the house again!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a small guy. I had to get my knee replaces last fall. Unfortunately there are things that still need done in the yard and in the house (like taking off the trap under the sink) best done from a kneeling position. My wife has a thing pad that came with a garden kit she received. it helped some, but i need one for 6"1 280 lbs. THIS IS IT! Its thick heavy duty foam. Its big enough both knees stay on it with room to spare, and even lets me shift position. If you need a pad and you're not petite, this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: G. Harris

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT for garage basement workplace  24 X 14 X 1-1/2
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for the shop where I work. My knees can't take the cement floors. Better than knee pads, because strap on knee pads shift around. I bought one for home, and I use it 95% of the time I need to kneel to do work on the motorcycle, bicycle, and car. Love it. Worth every dollar, and get the big one. Easy to store too. Right against the tool cart.
customer_reviews.author: ToolmanJohn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable while I've been kneeling on the driveway doing work ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable while I've been kneeling on the driveway doing work on my vehicles to save my knees from gravel and pebbles. Also worked out well when the driveway was soaked from rain and I had to change a headlight bulb that required access through the wheel well as the snow came down. Made the job a bit more tolerable, and serves as a decent headrest when you're face-up under a car having to change out pulleys and belts and save your skull from uneven concrete joints.
customer_reviews.author: spasmonaut

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, thickness / cushiony, and knee-saving!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so that we could bathe our newborn son in our bathtub without killing our knees. It is terrific so far. Have been using it for about 2.5 months now. Didn't even remove the plastic that it came in. Very thick with nice give. Saves our knees! Also like that it doesn't have any terrible odor that often comes w/ rubber-ish items...
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Use this ANYWHERE successfully!
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling pad is terrific! I used it within the first minute of taking it out of the box. It’s thick...it’s waterproof...it’s comfortable enough for both your knees & your back-side...AND...the great price is the icing on the “padded” cake! There will be no space in my garden out of comfortable reach for me now!
customer_reviews.author: seana

customer_reviews.title: On your knees! Yeah You!
customer_reviews.text: It's a foam like pad that will keep jagged rocks, sharp glass, nails and other hazards in the garden from piercing your sexy knees. Also great around the garage or to take with you and sit on at the stadium. Mine is still newish so durability remains to be proven but so far, I'm happy and my knees are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Horse-N-Round

customer_reviews.title: To Hard and Dense to Cushion your Knees Comfortably
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pad to protect my knees when I climb onto the tailgate on my truck knees down. I have had a number of pads that are soft and firm enough to protect the knees. This pad looks nice, but is much to hard, or dense to feel good on the knees. I am hoping that it breaks in and gets softer. I should probably return it. Received it quickly and it was well packed. Disappointed for sure--wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rather Be Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: unbeatable quality, now in black! :D
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable material longevity -the new standard by which all other pads should be measured. But for goodness sake, give us a black option! This hospital blue is jarring. Update June 2017: They listened! I'm going to get myself a black one soon enough. My blue one was easily able to be sawed down to size for my kneeling chair and it has NO dents or noticeable sign of use after months of abuse! Incredible material. I wonder where it's made...
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: ... as a bath pad (standing) as I have a bad foot deformity and I needed something to help with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a bath pad (standing) as I have a bad foot deformity and I needed something to help with standing in the bath that was very painful when taking a shower. With the kneeling pad, I can stand on that with both feet (width is perfect) and it gives me the softness I need to be able to take a shower without pain. It is also waterproof so it does not saturate with water. Does exactly what I needed it to do!
customer_reviews.author: HappySnappyWaldo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kneeling pad.....buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling pad is perfect! I bought it for the garden, but instead I’m keeping it by my bed for prayers. Kneeling on this pad is comfortable and it it just the right size for sliding into the space between my nightstand and bookcase. Durable, lightweight and just brilliant! I really love it!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Bowlby

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought one of these many years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, waterproof pad. The finger cutout makes it easy to move around. I use mine mostly to do maintenance and cleanup work on my cars and motorcycles and the waterproof feature is welcome for that. I used it in the yard the other day and got it a little muddy. It just rinsed off and was like new again. I bought another one for my daughter to use when bathing our youngest grandchild. She wished she'd had it for the other two kids. Inexpensive, comfortable tool.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!!
customer_reviews.text: This order was delivered to our house in an extremely beat up box. There were only two kneeling pads inside and I ordered and paid for three.. This was an order that I placed to give to our daughters for Mothers Day...not happy!!! I would not give any stars, but had to in order to submit.
customer_reviews.author: william b jensen

customer_reviews.title: Usable, but a lot denser/stiffer than I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: It's about as advertised. My only problem is that it is a lot denser/stiffer than I had hoped it would be. Still usable, but a little less than ideal for me. Update 1/1/17. Upgradedto 4 stars after some more use. Still stiffer than what I had hoped for, but now a bit more comfortable than first thought.
customer_reviews.author: VNS

customer_reviews.title: Kneeler is way too hard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a kneeling pad for gardening and for floor cleaning in the house. This pad was the only one I could find that was a nice wide size. Most are way too narrow to get both knees on. However, when it arrived, I found the product to be so hard that it doesn't provide any cushioning. I didn't even take it out of the shrink wrap. I'm returning it because it wouldn't be any softer than the ground.
customer_reviews.author: EOJ-Kid

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kneeling pad!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the larger size and this kneeling pad is just what I wanted for my gardening needs! My middle-aged knees need good cushion and support, and this pad provides that. I love the neutral gray color, and the generous size of the larger one. Very comfy and easy to carry. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Introvert, Inspired

customer_reviews.title: Durable product that works
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable Durable Works A little stiffer than I expected but it turned out to be better for supporting the weight of my knees and is perfectly comfortable, no joint pains. Also stays firmly in place on tile, carpet, desk chair plastic mat. On wood with great effort you can slide it around but you won't move unless you want to. Give it a week to get used to it, I have had it for a couple months and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Grumpy Knees
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this extra thick pad. I have to get down on my knees to clean out the cat litter boxes, daily and to do other household chores, and this makes my knees and my body very, very happy. It's light and super cushiony. If you're looking for some kindness for your knees, then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: YogaMaux

customer_reviews.title: Will save your knees!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is always doing something around the house & we have travertine floors & his poor knees couldn't take it anymore. glad I decided to check out Amazon & buy a good quality pad vs the $5 gardening type, it's a large, thick pad, sturdy & well made - worth the almost $14 price tag!
customer_reviews.author: SilInSunnyFL

customer_reviews.title: Nice well made kneeling pad
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a kneeling pad to use around the house, yard and garage, knees are not as forgiving as they once were. This pad is the perfect size and thickness for my use, I like that the pad was delivered with the core intact in the handle area, I have no use for a handle but with the core still in place the handle area is not exposed giving me more space and a pad that is non directional. The extra thickness of this pad really works for me, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: HARD AS A ROCK
customer_reviews.text: HARD AS A BRICK BAT, AND DESIGNED FOR THE BUTT OF A BARBIE DOLL. I SENT ONE FIRST TO A FRIEND FOR HER BIRTHDAY GIFT. I LATER ORDERED ONE FOR MYSELF. WHEN I SAW MINE, I TEXTED HER TO APOLOGIZE FOR THE LAME GIFT I HAD SENT TO HER. HER ANSWER: THAT'S OK.. IT'S THE THOUGHT THAT COUNTS. WHAT DOES THAT TELL YOU?
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardening
customer_reviews.text: This foam pad is actually thicker than I thought it would be, which is great for my knees when I'm gardening, but that added padding does take away from some of the flexibility, so I do have a few concerns about accidentally cracking it or outright snapping it in half if I'm on uneven terrain. For the time being, though, I'm sure this will work well for light duties like weeding in my yard or planting flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Jana at FantasyLiterature

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling pad really has no padding! It is very, very hard and practically unyielding. If you need padding for your knees as I do when kneeling, please choose a different kneeling pad. Because of the inconvenience to return, I re-purposed this for floor protection when I bring in a heavy toolbox to work on a project in a room with hardwood or tile.
customer_reviews.author: RSV

customer_reviews.title: Very Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our vacation. We went to Spencer ID. to mine opal, we sat on these mats or kneeled on them all day on rough rock. My parents brought 2 from another place and almost as thin as paper. These were amazing, nice sized, very thick sitting or kneeling on these we did not feel anything but comfort. Now when we traded the parents for theirs, well felt every rock and wished we had bought 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use while bathing my toddler but it's hard as a brick and way too expensive for what it is. There's barely a difference between the hardness of this and my bathroom floor.
customer_reviews.author: MegS

customer_reviews.title: saving my knees!
customer_reviews.text: This was/is perfect for doing gardening around my condo and I'm glad I got this version at extra thick. Comfortable, quality looking, good and sturdy at being knelt on when it's on either concrete or grass. Nice handle cut-out for toting easily around my yard. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Austin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Using for kneeling at work. I like the bright color too, makes it easier to find as I roam around to different work locations. If I forget to pick it up and bring it with me, the color makes it stand out when I go back to look for it. Seems like it will last a lot longer than the memory foam pads I've been blowing through for the past couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: PA Mom

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD, YOUR KNEES WILL THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.text: Gave item as a gift to several people who spend considerable time working on their knees in various environments. Too early to see how durable they end up being, but they are surely a helpful invention. Like the handle and the scalloped edge. Was really looking for this in assorted pastels/brights, but couldn't find any (that were thick enough). It is a great thickness. Thank you! Well really I guess you should be thanking me for buying it and reviewing it. Thank you anyway for your nice product!
customer_reviews.author: A Celestial Luminary

customer_reviews.title: This pad is large and thick
customer_reviews.text: This pad is large, making it perfect to sit on while working on my car, in the garden, or anything where I'll be on a hard surface. Is a sturdy piece of foam. The handle makes it easy to carry and store on a nail on the wall. l would not hesitate to buy this again
customer_reviews.author: R. Parker

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I got such a think pad and highly recommend ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband thinks he is a master gardener, which he is not, but he does try. He kept complaining about his knees so I purchased this to hush him up - AND IT WORKED! How a little knee pad could do so much is unreal. I am glad I got such a thick pad and highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Margo the Great

customer_reviews.title: Good on the knees
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of iffy about buying this for my boyfriend after reading the reviews because of how firm some people were complaining about and they were right it is firm but he is a mechanic and uses this all the time and loves it. It did take a couple of times using it to break in but now he said it is perfect. You honestly just have to use it to break it in so it forms to your knees, if you aren't going to use it everyday of course it will stay firm.
customer_reviews.author: Jami R

customer_reviews.title: Knees thanking me for buying this!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pad almost daily in my garden, sometimes kneeling on it; sometimes sitting on it and it's great. Good firm support and my knees don't hurt as much after weeding. The large size is exactly what I wanted - other pads have been too short. I have placed this on wet dirt, dry dirt, mowed grass...etc and it really doesn't need much cleaning. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Cook  and Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Hate to admit that I need this knee pad but I am glad I have this one. I can take care of things on the floor again.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Perlin

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Works as expected. Used it when clearing a area to seat on as I was cutting close to the ground. Was very pleased with the performance of the product. there is cut outs for the hand holder area I kept and use to prop up my cell phone at my desk or when i am watching a movie or stocks on my cell phone. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: K.H. in TN.

customer_reviews.title: A great Father's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: Received this as a Father's Day gift from my wife and son and this kneeling pad definitely has saved my knees and butt when I'm gardening. During our COVID stay at home orders, I've taken up gardening and I've been doing a lot of planting, and I prefer to sit or kneel as opposed to stooping or bending over. So happy with the quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: A Train

customer_reviews.title: Great for prayer
customer_reviews.text: I'm Catholic and I always see on TV kids kneeling by their beds and praying. I have hard floors so it's torture for me, so I always grabbed a sweater or something. Then I saw this. I keep it under my bed and just slide it out to pray, and slide it back under my bed when I'm done. If my son decides to pray with me, I'll buy one for him too.
customer_reviews.author: Ale.mom.91

customer_reviews.title: Works for saving my knees
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than my existing pad but it doesn't seem to have a tough outer surface. Some of my tools have taken little chunks out of it because it lacks a protective skin. For now it's doing OK - give me a couple of months and I'll revisit this review.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doakes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kneepad
customer_reviews.text: The pad has good width and length, so I didn't have to cramp my legs together, and can even shift around a bit as I worked. It's not made from the softest of knee pad foam materials, but the thickness compensates to some extent and it is comfortable to kneel on for extended periods of time. It's also easy to clean and didn't get damaged from use on rough outdoor surfaces and materials.
customer_reviews.author: buyer of stuff

customer_reviews.title: This is very practical.
customer_reviews.text: Love this kneeler. I used to put two thinner, less supportive kneeling pads together and this one is way sturdy and supportive. I have no discomfort at all even staying on my knees for a long time weeding. It is well worth the price. I'm thinking it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Thielen

customer_reviews.title: Great kneeling mat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kneeling mat. Quick delivery and mat is just as described. This mat gives great knee support on hard surfaces. I read a review that said it was too hard. It is very firm but that is why it will hold up a long time even when used outdoors or on cement. A cushy mat does not even compare. Plus you can wash this mat and hang til next use. I'm ordering another, it's that good.
customer_reviews.author: Dyana Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great knee pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knee pad! I have some knee problems, and this gives good comfort and is thick enough that you don't sink into the ground at all. Firm, but a good amount of give when you kneel on it. Good size and good quality. I would by this again when I need another.
customer_reviews.author: aznavymom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sturdy and large enough to put your knees on without falling off! I would highly recommend this product! Fro reference my husband and I both use it for roller abs and push ups. I am 5 1" 120 LBS and my husband is 6 1" 180 LBS
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: This is a knee saver!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of hurting my knees on hard surfaces so I tried this out. Results: This product is a lightweight kneeling pad that is made of a high quality thick foam. I used it to kneel as I was the tires on my car. It's also perfect for gardening or using it as a kneeling mat. There is no doubt this will last a long time based on the quality materials used.
customer_reviews.author: D. Behrendt

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious kneeling mat!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I upgraded to this thick and sturdy kneeling pad for gardening and any other work around the house that requires kneeling. I had a much thinner pad for years- wish I saw this one. Great quality, dries fast and cleans up well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty kneeling pad
customer_reviews.text: These are very firm and tough cushions that anyone of any size can use. You will not feel rocks in a garden. I bought two of them so I could put them together for a larger surface when needed. The combination scalloped and straight edge on the opposite long sides is nice looking, but the currentn design prevents direct interlock of two cushions. It is not a big thing, but using a uniform scalloped would allow for an even or staggered interlock for unique application. The company used to sell a larger cushion, but it apparently is no longer available. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob from Missouri

product_meta.title: Thick Kneeling Pad, Garden Kneeler for Gardening, Bath Kneeler for Baby Bath, Kneeling Mat for Exercise & Yoga, Knee Pad for Work, Floor Foam Pad, Extra Large (XL) 18 x 11 x 1.5 Inches, Black
feature_bullets: PATENT-PENDING COMFORTABLE KNEELING PAD - Our Patent-Pending kneeling pad is great for kneeling and helps reduce pain. It is made with the perfect balance of support and comfort - providing you the comfort and support your body needs while keeping you steady

EXTRA THICK 1-½ INCH - THICKER than other kneeling pads or garden kneelers on the market. Thick kneeling pad will provide the best support and keep you steady while kneeling. THE PERFECT SIZE - Extra Large (XL) 18 X 11 inch - Accommodates your knees with room to spare, but is still small enough for easy storage

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL KNEELER - It’s great for gardening, but it is also great for baby bath time, household chores, exercise and yoga, camping, sport events, home installation and repair, auto repair, and perfect for tradesmen of all kinds including floorers, plumbers, painters, carpenters, mechanics, and especially for the gardener

DURABLE, HIGH DENSITY FOAM - The garden kneeler is constructed with High Density, Non-Recycled material that will last for many years. This kneeling mat will not break down or compress over time and is designed to withstand impacts from stones and rough ground when used outdoors. MINIMAL WATER ABSORPTION material ensures the bath kneeler is easy to clean and it dries quickly. LIGHTWEIGHT & PORTABLE - lightweight enough to take it anywhere and the built-in handle makes it easy to carry

100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE & 1 YEAR WARRANTY - Backed by a NO QUESTIONS ASKED, 100% Satisfaction Guarantee - We will replace your kneel pad or offer a full refund if for any reason you aren’t completely satisfied with your order. 1 YEAR WARRANTY - Premium product get Premium Warranty, ensuring peace of mind
